name: Fresh Fettuccine Pasta
instructions: Mix 00 flour and semolina flour together on a clean surface.
Make a well in the center and add eggs, salt, and olive oil.
Using a fork, gradually incorporate the flour into the eggs.
Once it forms a shaggy dough, knead by hand for 8-10 minutes until smooth.
Wrap dough in plastic wrap and let it rest at room temperature for 30-45 minutes.
Divide dough into 2-3 pieces and roll each piece into thin sheets (setting 5-6 on a pasta machine).
Cut into fettuccine using a cutter or by hand (6-7mm wide).
Dust lightly with semolina to prevent sticking and let rest for 10-15 minutes.
Bring salted water to a rolling boil. Cook fresh pasta for 1-3 minutes.
Drain and toss immediately with sauce.

storage_tips.refrigeration: Wrap tightly and store in the fridge for up to 2 days.
storage_tips.freezing: Freeze in nests on a tray, then transfer to a bag for up to 1 month.
